New Records: Gunnar Henderson tied Hall of Famer Cal Ripken Jr. and six-time All-Star Miguel Tejada with the most homers by a Baltimore shortstop in a season
Key Match Events: Henderson's 34th dinger did more than snap a streak of not scoring a run in eight days
The O’s leadoff hitter hammered a 92.8 mph fastball on a 1-1 count into center field at 108.2 mph
The leadoff knock was the O’s 12th leadoff home run of the season -- which is tied for most leadoff home runs in franchise history, set in 1996, and leads MLB this year
The offense erupted and scored six runs in the sixth to extend the lead to 11-2
Each Orioles starter recorded a hit and scored a run for the first time since Aug. 25, 2017
Post-Match Reflections: Baltimore continued to build onto its attack as the game went on, taking a 3-2 lead in the third inning and adding two more runs in the fifth
The August struggles seem to be behind them
Usually, you have one of those games to kind of get you going and [it] all of a sudden sparks everyone, and everyone starts raking. So hopefully this is the game that carries us.
Others: By the end of the game, each Orioles starter recorded a hit and scored a run for the first time since Aug. 25, 2017
